title: Plenty of heart: miracle Little Leaguer now HS football player
text:
Plenty of heart: miracle Little Leaguer now HS football player 
Updated: 
Posted by: Jason Bristol 
ELIZABETHVILLE -- If you don't remember a young boy from an old Harrisburg Senators game, tossing out a first pitch, don't worry -- we're checking up on him. 
That thrower is now a pass-catcher for the Upper Dauphin football team. 
"Its lucky that I'm alive and being able to do this," said Colton Laudenslager, a senior. 
So what happened to Colton? 
When he was eight-years-old playing in a Little League game, he was struck by a ball in a chest while batting. Moments later, his heart stopped beating for nearly two minutes. 
"Right when I got to first base...I (then) woke up behind the dugout," recalled Laudenslager. 
By chance, a doctor was there and revived Colton before he was airlifted to a hospital. 
CBS 21 News met Colton shortly thereafter -- in August 2006 -- when the Harrisburg Senators minor league baseball team, after learning of Colton's ordeal, invited him to a game. 
Nine years later, his father is still thanking the family's lucky stars. 
"Pretty much everyday before I go to bed," said Kevin Laudenslager. 
How about very lucky. "Yes, especially since there are people who die from it," said Colton. 
There's a medical term for what Colton experienced. Its called commotio cordis and boys and teenagers have died from similar blows to the heart. 
And Colton barely made it. 
Yet the most fascinating part of Colton's miracle? It now comes into play nearly every day. 
Up to this point, he says he's encountered no side effects: no matter what he plays or how often he plays for head coach Brent Bell. "We don't have a lot of one-way players," said Bell before a recent practice. "Colton's pretty much on offense, defense and probably all of special teams." 
And Colton plans on remaining active. 
"I want to do active duty...military," he said. 
He loves his country. He loves his family. He loves his football. 
Yup, that's little boy's heart checks out just fine.
